cardinfo.CI: Streblus - Sand Paper Tree/Sand Paper Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: Sand Paper Tree is a rigid and densely branched tree growing from 4-10 m in height. The leaves are oblong-obovate to sub-rhomboid, 4-12 cm long, very rough on both sides, with finely toothed margin, the tip blunt or tapering to a point and the base narrowed. The male flowers are in rounded heads, 4-7 mm in diameter, short peduncled, greenish-yellow, or nearly white. The female flowers are stalked, usually in pairs, green, the sepals become larger after flowering, and nearly enclose the fruit. The fruit is ovoid, 8-10 mm long, pale yellow, the pericarp soft and fleshy. The seed is ovoid, and 5-6 mm long. Thrue to its name, the leaves of Sand Paper Tree are rough and are utilized for cleaning cooking utensils and as a substitute for sandpaper.

English: Siamese rough bush, Khoi, Serut, Toothbrush tree, Sand paper tree
Assamese: Khorua, Saura gach
Bengali: শ্যাওড়া, Sehora, Sahra, Shewra, Shaora
Hindi: दहिया पेड़, Daheya, Dahia, Karchanna, Rusa, Sahora, Sihora
Kannada: Akhor moranu, Mitala
Khasi: Dieng sohkhyrdang
Malayalam: പരുവമരം, Parakam, Paruva, Sakhotavrksam, Tinda-parua
Marathi: Poi, Karera, Kharoli, Kharota, Sahor
Nepali: दातुन, सोडा, सिहोर, काक्सी, बेडुला, Bedulaa, Kaaksee, Sihor, Sodaa, Daatun

Sanskrit: Akshadhara, Bhutavasa, Bhutavriksha, Dhukavasa, Gavakshi, Karkashachhada
